description: Nikola Petrak decides to support the vanished citizens. Using documents from his locked briefcase, he initiates decryption of digital archives, compiling verified identities and personal testimonies of those erased from BCI records.

Coordinated by the vanished and enabled by Nikola's data release, a group of erased citizens takes over major city broadcast channels. They air raw testimonies and reveal evidence of secret BCI erasures tied to Halden's 2024 data centralization order.

The citizens of Stenograd are galvanized by the personal stories of the erased. Protests swell as residents demand a freeze on BCI enforcement, while sympathetic BCI administrators begin siding with the resistance, amplifying calls for change.

Facing mounting public and internal pressure, the Innovators publicly propose amnesty and mediated hearings for erased citizens, suggesting their involvement in developing a new governance model free from BCI abuses.

Council unity collapses as the Directorate refuses amnesty proposals. The resulting deadlock deepens the BCI's operational paralysis, accelerating the breakdown of automated governance throughout Stenograd.
